results.title: After the Warming
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Richard Sattin and Mike Slee
results.brief_description: It is the year 2050. Mankind and the earth have survived global warming. In an innovative new television project, social journalist James Burke looks back from the future of several scenarios of global warming and their possible effects on continents, countries and mankind. He explores the preventative roads not taken and the potential results.

results.title: After the Montreal massacre
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Nicole Hubert and Gerry Rogers
results.brief_description: In 1989 Marc Lepine shot and killed 14 women students. As he opened fire he yelled “You’re all a bunch of feminists”. This program is a useful tool not only in analysing this femicide, but throws light on what has become an increasing trend of male violence against women. Sylvie Gagnon, a survivor of the massacre, and other Canadian women talk of their fears, the influence of the media and social conditions, the Women’s Movement and the need to be empowered. The pervasive thread underlying their narrative is that violence towards women is not a solitary act committed by a disturbed personality, but instilled into the cultural and social fabric of society as one of the most pervasive yet least recognised violations of Human Rights. The haunting images taken on the day of the massacre and in the days following, are terrifying and moving, challenging us to explore the urgent issues of misogyny, male violence and sexism.

results.title: After the miracle
results.brief_description: A broad view of life in Israel in 1966. Covers economic and social development and some problems; the settling of millions of immigrants, the continuous threat of invasion, the lack of natural resources. Discusses the active and varied religious and political life, and the advanced state of science and technology

results.title: After the glaciers
results.brief_description: Shows how much of the northern hemisphere surged back to abundant life during the periods of ice age retreat. Follows the pattern of plant succession, from lichens to mosses, to a forest.

results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Film Australia and Suzanne Baker

results.title: After the First
results.creator_credit: Teleketics, Karl Holtsnider and Nicholas Frangakis
results.brief_description: An open-ended film which explores a young boy’s emotions throughout his first hunting trip. Describes how the boy’s initial excitement, his mother’s concern and his father’s impatient pride all come together at the climactic moment of the killing. Designed to promote discussion on violence, fathers and sons, ecology, growing up and social conditioning. Designed to promote discussion on violence, fathers and sons, ecology, growing up and social conditioning.

results.title: After the axe
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Ontario Regional Productions, Sturla Gunnarsson and Steve Lucas
results.brief_description: 250,000 managers get fired in North America annually. A cinematic drama drawn from real life examining executive terminations and a new industry specialising in handling them. The central figure, D.R. “Biff” Wilson, 44, is a composite figure based on extensive conversations with fired executives; the others play themselves. An interesting look at business ethics. (Awards: New York, Yorkton, Chicago, Oscar nomination)

results.title: After the 'ouch'
results.brief_description: After a series of small accidents, children apply first aid for a cut, splinter, bruise, nosebleed and minor burn. Also indicates correct response to a serious accident. Animation is used to show aspects of physiology. Suitab le for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: After Proust
results.creator_credit: Galadriel Films, Christopher McGill and John Baxter
results.brief_description: A fleeting encounter between a man and a woman is treated in a romantic fashion. Set in Edwardian Sydney, the film is intended to suggest the atmosphere of the period and the narrative style of Marcel Proust.
